recommendation_doctor: Follow institutional NPO guidelines: clear fluids until 2 hours before anesthesia; solids 6–8 hours before anesthesia depending on patient and anesthesia plan. Adjust fasting for infants and those with gastroparesis.
recommendation_patient: Do not eat solid food for 6–8 hours and no clear liquids 2 hours before your operation unless told otherwise.
notes: Adjust fasting instructions for diabetic patients and infants as per pediatric/anesthesia guidance.

recommendation_doctor: Obtain pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential prior to anesthesia unless pregnancy excluded reliably; document LMP.
recommendation_patient: If you are of childbearing age, you may be asked to take a pregnancy test before surgery.
notes: Essential for teratogenic risk and anesthetic planning.

recommendation_doctor: Administer appropriate prophylactic antibiotic within 60 minutes before incision (agent chosen by procedure and local antibiogram). Redose intra-op if surgery prolonged.
recommendation_patient: You will receive an antibiotic just before surgery to lower infection risk—tell staff about any allergies.
notes: Select agent based on surgery (e.g., cefazolin for many clean cases; add gram-negative/anaerobic coverage where indicated).

recommendation_doctor: Plan mechanical and pharmacologic VTE prophylaxis based on risk (e.g., LMWH, DOACs post-op) and bleeding risk; begin pharmacologic prophylaxis per protocol.
recommendation_patient: You may receive injections or wear compression stockings to prevent blood clots after surgery. Inform staff about any previous clots.
notes: Total joint arthroplasty requires aggressive thromboprophylaxis.

recommendation_doctor: High predicted cardiac risk — arrange cardiology review, ECG, echocardiography as indicated, and optimize heart failure/ischemia therapy before elective surgery.
recommendation_patient: Your heart risk is high. You may need extra heart tests and a cardiology visit before operation.
notes: Balance urgency against optimization; involve multidisciplinary team.

recommendation_doctor: Consider stopping warfarin ~5 days before elective surgery and check INR pre-op. Assess thrombosis risk and consider peri-op bridging with LMWH per cardiology/hematology guidance.
recommendation_patient: Do not take warfarin for several days before surgery unless advised; your team will tell you when to stop.
notes: Timeframes may vary; manage urgent cases case-by-case.

recommendation_doctor: If patient has recent coronary stent, consult cardiology regarding timing and antiplatelet management. Avoid premature cessation of dual antiplatelet therapy without specialist input.
recommendation_patient: You are on antiplatelet medicines for a heart stent. Do not stop them without talking to your cardiologist and surgeon.
notes: Time since stent and type matter — keep detailed PCI history.

recommendation_doctor: Create perioperative glycemic plan: hold/adjust oral hypoglycemics per protocol, individualize insulin regimen, monitor glucose frequently and treat hypo/hyperglycemia per guidelines. Consider delaying elective surgery if HbA1c >8.0.
recommendation_patient: Follow instructions about diabetes medicines the day before and day of surgery. Bring glucose monitoring supplies.
notes: Steroid use may require extra monitoring.

recommendation_doctor: Investigate anemia etiology and treat prior to elective surgery: iron therapy (oral/IV), B12/folate replacement as indicated, or erythropoiesis-stimulating agents where appropriate.
recommendation_patient: Your blood count is low. See your doctor for tests/treatment to improve safety before surgery.
notes: Optimize to reduce transfusion and infection risk.

recommendation_doctor: Assess eGFR, adjust renally cleared drug dosing, avoid nephrotoxins, and plan hydration for contrast studies. Consider nephrology consult for major procedures.
recommendation_patient: Your kidney tests will be checked before any scans with contrast; follow hydration instructions.
notes: Thresholds depend on eGFR and institutional policy.
guideline_ref: Radiology contrast and renal function guidance

recommendation_doctor: Assess airway and OSA risk (e.g., STOP-BANG); plan for peri-op CPAP availability and respiratory physiotherapy. Consider anesthesia airway plan and postoperative monitoring.
recommendation_patient: Your BMI suggests higher risk for breathing issues during anesthesia—your team will check and may advise tests or equipment.
notes: Record STOP-BANG if available.

recommendation_doctor: Advise smoking cessation ideally 4 weeks before elective surgery; offer nicotine replacement therapy and cessation support.
recommendation_patient: Stop smoking as soon as possible before surgery. Ask your doctor about nicotine patches or support programs.
notes: Even short-term cessation reduces pulmonary/wound complications.

recommendation_doctor: Review immunosuppressants (steroids, biologics) and time-to-hold per specialty guidance; optimize vaccination status and infection prevention.
recommendation_patient: Tell your doctor about medicines that lower immunity; special precautions may be needed.
notes: Coordinate timing of biologics with surgical plan.

recommendation_doctor: Follow pediatric fasting and weight-based dosing protocols; involve pediatric anesthesia and provide caregiver education.
recommendation_patient: Caregivers will receive separate pediatric instructions and fasting guidance.
notes: Consider prematurity and birth history when relevant.

recommendation_doctor: For pregnant patients, coordinate with obstetrics and anesthesia; weigh fetal and maternal risks for timing and perioperative monitoring.
recommendation_patient: If pregnant or suspect pregnancy, inform your surgical team; specific planning will follow.
notes: Some procedures are deferred when possible.

recommendation_doctor: Plan for potential major blood loss in joint replacement: type & screen, arrange cell salvage, tranexamic acid and blood conservation strategies.
recommendation_patient: Your surgery may involve blood loss—tests and plans will be made to keep you safe.
notes: TXA commonly reduces transfusion needs in ortho.

recommendation_doctor: Neurosurgical cases: confirm anticoagulant/antiplatelet status and plan correction or reversal where possible; coordinate with hematology and neurosurgery.
recommendation_patient: If you take blood thinners and need brain or spine surgery, specialist coordination is essential.
notes: Balance bleeding vs thrombotic risks carefully in neuro ops.

recommendation_doctor: Discuss antiplatelet/anticoagulant management with ophthalmology; many minor eye procedures permit single antiplatelet but confirm for high-bleeding procedures.
recommendation_patient: Bring a list of your medicines; only stop blood thinners if the surgeon tells you to.
notes: Risk varies by ophthalmic procedure (cataract vs vitreoretinal).

recommendation_doctor: For transrectal/rectal urologic procedures consider bowel prep and targeted antibiotics according to urology protocol.
recommendation_patient: You may need bowel preparation and antibiotics—follow the surgical team's instructions.
notes: Subtypes important for triggering this rule.

recommendation_doctor: Assess anemia and counsel regarding potential blood loss for gynecologic surgery; consider type & screen and TXA where appropriate.
recommendation_patient: If tests show low blood counts, your doctor may recommend treatment before elective gynecological surgery.
notes: Discuss fertility-preserving options when relevant.

recommendation_doctor: Provide pre-op pulmonary optimization: smoking cessation, chest physiotherapy, and baseline pulmonary function tests if indicated.
recommendation_patient: You may be asked to do breathing exercises and stop smoking to reduce lung complications.
notes: Aggressive respiratory prep reduces post-op pulmonary complications.

recommendation_doctor: Consider renal risk with contrast studies; plan hydration, minimize contrast volume, and adjust renally cleared meds.
recommendation_patient: If contrast scans are planned, your kidneys will be checked; follow hydration instructions.
notes: Coordinate with radiology for renal-protective strategies.

recommendation_doctor: Strict smoking cessation and glycemic optimization required for reconstructive/plastic cases; consider delaying elective cases until optimized.
recommendation_patient: Stop smoking and get blood sugar under control to improve healing after reconstructive/plastic surgery.
notes: High priority due to wound/flap failure risk.

recommendation_doctor: Consider dental/oral infection screening and treat dental sepsis before prosthetic implant or cardiac surgery.
recommendation_patient: Address any tooth or mouth infections before your scheduled operation.
notes: Dental source control reduces prosthetic infection risk.

recommendation_doctor: Consider prehabilitation (exercise, nutrition, smoking cessation) before major elective surgery to reduce complications and length of stay.
recommendation_patient: You may be advised to do exercises and follow a nutrition plan to prepare for your operation.
notes: Tailor prehab to baseline fitness and comorbidity.

recommendation_doctor: Review vaccination status (influenza, pneumococcus, COVID where relevant) and optimize as appropriate prior to elective major surgery.
recommendation_patient: Ensure routine vaccinations are up to date; discuss with clinician.
notes: Timing relative to surgery and immunosuppression required.

recommendation_doctor: Assess for chronic steroid use and risk of adrenal suppression; give peri-op stress-dose steroids if indicated by endocrinology guidance.
recommendation_patient: Tell staff if you take steroids regularly; special steroid cover may be needed.
notes: Dose and need depend on duration/dose of steroids.

recommendation_doctor: Review psychotropic medications and consult psychiatry as needed; assess peri-op continuation versus hold depending on agent.
recommendation_patient: Bring a list of mental health medicines and follow instructions about taking them before surgery.
notes: Avoid abrupt cessation of some agents (e.g., benzodiazepines).

recommendation_doctor: Consider MRSA/MSSA screening and decolonization protocols for high-risk procedures (e.g., prosthetic implants).
recommendation_patient: You may be screened for nasal or skin bacteria and asked to use antiseptic washes.
notes: Follow local infection control policies.

recommendation_doctor: Offer pregnancy testing to females of childbearing potential prior to anesthesia unless reliably not pregnant.
recommendation_patient: If you are of childbearing age, you may be asked for a pregnancy test before surgery.
notes: Document LMP if available.

recommendation_doctor: Plan multimodal analgesia to reduce opioid requirements, and consider regional blocks where appropriate.
recommendation_patient: You may be offered different pain control options that reduce reliance on strong opioids.
notes: Regional anesthesia may shorten LOS and improve pain control for certain procedures.

recommendation_doctor: Ensure adequate IV/central venous access planning for prolonged or complex procedures.
recommendation_patient: Your team will plan the best way to give medicines and fluids during the operation.
notes: Coordinate with anesthesia for lines and monitoring.

recommendation_doctor: Plan for potential major blood loss: arrange type & screen, crossmatch if indicated, consider cell salvage and blood conservation strategies.
recommendation_patient: Your surgery may involve blood loss; tests and plans will be made.
notes: Specific plans vary by expected blood loss and institutional protocols.

recommendation_doctor: Screen and treat dental/oral infections prior to ENT or maxillofacial surgery.
recommendation_patient: Address any tooth or mouth infections before the scheduled operation.
notes: Dental source control sometimes required for prosthetic/cardiac surgeries.

recommendation_doctor: Assess timing relative to recent COVID infection and follow current local guidance for delay and respiratory optimization.
recommendation_patient: Report recent COVID-19 infection to your surgical team; timing of elective surgery may be adjusted.
notes: Use up-to-date institutional guidance.

recommendation_doctor: Avoid teratogenic drugs in pregnancy where possible and consult obstetrics/anesthesia for necessary procedures.
recommendation_patient: If pregnant, certain medications and procedures may be changed to protect the fetus.
notes: Coordinate obstetric and anesthesia planning for pregnant surgical patients.

recommendation_doctor: Review antiplatelet/anticoagulant use and bleeding risk by ophthalmic procedure subtype; consult surgeon for high-risk operations.
recommendation_patient: Bring a list of medicines to the pre-op visit; follow surgeon's instructions about blood thinners.
notes: Cataract operations often tolerate single antiplatelet therapy.

recommendation_doctor: Consider regional anesthesia/nerve blocks when appropriate to reduce postoperative opioid use and improve analgesia.
recommendation_patient: You may be offered a regional block to help with pain after surgery.
notes: Coordinate with anesthesia for patient suitability.

recommendation_doctor: Coordinate timing of immunosuppressive agents and infection prophylaxis with transplant team; involve infectious diseases.
recommendation_patient: Transplant patients require special medication planning—discuss with transplant coordinator.
notes: High complexity; follow transplant program protocols.

recommendation_doctor: Assess social support, discharge needs, and arrange rehabilitation or home support preoperatively where indicated.
recommendation_patient: Make arrangements for transport and someone to help you at home after the operation.
notes: Early discharge planning reduces length of stay and readmissions.

recommendation_doctor: Consider baseline ECG and labs for patients >50 years planned for surgery; tailor further testing to comorbidities and procedural risk.
recommendation_patient: You may need blood tests and an ECG before the operation because of your age or medical history.
notes: Adjust age thresholds per institutional policy.

recommendation_doctor: Assess nutritional status and consider dietitian referral and supplementation to reduce wound complications and improve recovery.
recommendation_patient: You may be asked to follow a nutrition plan or take supplements before the operation.
notes: Include recent weight loss data when possible.

recommendation_doctor: Develop an individualized peri-op analgesia plan for chronic opioid users including multimodal strategies and pain service input.
recommendation_patient: Bring a list of your pain medicines; pain control plans may change around surgery.
notes: Avoid abrupt opioid cessation; coordinate with pain management.

recommendation_doctor: Plan for central venous/arterial access where prolonged hemodynamic monitoring or vasoactive therapy anticipated.
recommendation_patient: Your team will plan the best way to give medicines and fluids during the operation.
notes: Coordinate lines with anesthesia and surgical teams.

recommendation_doctor: Ensure surgical site marking and pre-op skin antisepsis. Document allergies to antiseptic agents (chlorhexidine, iodine).
recommendation_patient: You will have the operation site marked and may be asked to use antiseptic washes before surgery.
notes: WHO Surgical Safety Checklist item.

recommendation_doctor: Follow urology-specific protocols for peri-op catheter use and targeted antibiotic prophylaxis for transurethral/transrectal procedures.
recommendation_patient: You may need catheter guidance and antibiotics as advised by the urology team.
notes: Minimize catheter days to reduce CAUTI risk.

recommendation_doctor: Assess thrombotic risk and plan bridging with LMWH for high-risk patients when warfarin is stopped prior to surgery per hematology/cardiology advice.
recommendation_patient: If you need temporary blood thinner changes, your doctor will advise on injections or alternative plans.
notes: Bridging decisions individualized.

recommendation_doctor: Assess airway and positioning needs for spine/neurosurgery; plan for potential neurological monitoring requirements.
recommendation_patient: Positioning and airway concerns will be discussed by the anesthesia and surgical teams.
notes: Positioning affects airway and monitoring.

recommendation_doctor: Cardiac surgical prophylaxis per cardiac surgical program (broad spectrum coverage, serial dosing during long procedures).
recommendation_patient: You will receive antibiotics before heart surgery to reduce infection risk.
notes: Follow cardiac surgery infection prevention bundle.

recommendation_doctor: Postpone elective surgery until active infections are resolved or controlled. For urgent cases stabilize infection and proceed with precautions.
recommendation_patient: If you have a fever, cough, or infection, inform your surgical team; surgery may be delayed.
notes: Balance urgency and infection control measures.

recommendation_doctor: Arrange type & screen/crossmatch based on expected blood loss and institutional transfusion thresholds; plan cell salvage where indicated.
recommendation_patient: Blood tests will be done to prepare for possible transfusion if needed.
notes: Individualize transfusion thresholds.

recommendation_doctor: Consider ECG and echocardiography as clinically indicated for patients with cardiac symptoms or moderate/high risk profiles.
recommendation_patient: You may need extra heart tests before the operation based on clinical assessment.
notes: Tests guided by symptoms and risk scores.

recommendation_doctor: Plan postoperative level of care (ICU/HDU/ward) prior to major procedures; coordinate bed availability and handover.
recommendation_patient: Your recovery location (ICU or ward) will be planned and explained before surgery.
notes: Advance planning reduces delays and improves handover.

recommendation_doctor: Review and advise on continuation/holding nonessential medications (e.g., metformin may be stopped the day of surgery for contrast risk depending on policy).
recommendation_patient: Bring a full list of medicines; the team will tell you which to take the day before and day of surgery.
notes: Follow local medication policies (e.g., metformin, ACE inhibitors).
